Class PropertyViewer

  • java.lang.Object
    • PropertyViewer
  • public class PropertyViewer
extends java.lang.Object
    This project implements a simple application. Properties from a fixed file can be displayed.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Michael KÃ¶lling and Josh Murphy

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      PropertyViewer()
      Create a PropertyViewer and display its GUI on screen.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int averagePropertyPrice()
      Return the avarage property price by dividing the sum of the prices of the propreties viwed with the number of properties viewed
      void display​(int index)
      Display property by index Show the ID of the property Show whether the property has been marked by the user as one of their favourites Every display of a property means a new viewing of that property
      int getNumberOfPropertiesViewed()
      add up how many times each property has been viewd and return the total nr of views
      void incrementViews​(Property property)
      Increment the number of views of a property by 1 Add its price to the total price of all properties viewed
      void nextProperty()
      Display the next property in the portofolio if there is one
      void previousProperty()
      Display the previous property in the portofolio if there is one
      void statistics()  
      void toggleFavourite()
      Updates the favourite status of the current proprety displayed and shows if the property is marked as favourite
      void viewMap()
      This method opens the system's default internet browser The Google maps page should show the current properties location on the map.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PropertyViewer

        public PropertyViewer()
        Create a PropertyViewer and display its GUI on screen. The first property in the portfolio (index 0) is displayed

    • Method Detail

      • display

        public void display​(int index)
        Display property by index Show the ID of the property Show whether the property has been marked by the user as one of their favourites Every display of a property means a new viewing of that property

             throws java.lang.Exception
